snippet: The United States, Britain and France, bowing to pressure from Saudi Arabia, dropped plans for an international investigation into the war in Yemen, to the dismay of human rights groups.
abstract: Western leaders withdraw support for Netherlands resolution directing United Nations to investigate war conduct in Yemen, instead favoring inquiry led by exiled Yemeni Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi; Netherlands proposal received heavy resistance from Saudi Arabia, which is leading multi-country coalition to crush insurgency in Yemen;  western supporters say Hadi's inquiry is more powerful and gives UN clear mandate to monitor and report on human rights issues in Yemen; human rights groups have expressed disappointment with decision.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The United States, Britain and France, bowing to pressure from Saudi Arabia, dropped plans for an international investigation into the war in Yemen, to the dismay of human rights groups.

headline.print_headline: Saudi Objections Halt U.N. Inquiry of Yemen War
headline.main: Saudi Objections Halt U.N. Inquiry of Yemen War
